meanings.definition: Situated at the rear or back of a ship or aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The aftmost cabin on the boat offered a great view of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The aftmost seat on the plane was next to the window.
meanings.sent3: The aftmost sailor kept bumping into the ship's railing, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts always lingered in the aftmost corners of her mind, hidden from view.
meanings.sent5: The aftmost part of the ship was painted a bright red, standing out against the blue sea.

meanings.sent1: The aftmost house on the street had a large backyard.
meanings.sent2: The aftmost car in the parking lot was covered in snow.
meanings.sent3: The aftmost student in the classroom always had trouble hearing the teacher.
meanings.sent4: His aftmost memories were of childhood summers spent by the lake.
meanings.sent5: The aftmost tree in the forest stood tall, reaching for the sky.
